faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle un bon endroit pour acheter un bien immobilier ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca consistently attracts international investment with 8% year-on-year price appreciation. The region offers transparent regulations, established expatriate communities, excellent climate, healthcare, and accessibility to European markets. faqs.question: Les étrangers peuvent-ils acheter un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign nationals possess identical property purchase rights as Spanish citizens. No residency requirements exist for property ownership. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE) and legal representation, both readily available through established property agents. Transparent regulations provide complete legal certainty.

faqs.question: Quels sont les frais d'achat d'un bien immobilier en Espagne ?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 8-12% of property price, including transfer tax (6-10%), notary fees (0.5%), and legal representation (1-2%). These amounts vary slightly by region. Ongoing property tax (IBI) averages 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value annually. Mortgage arrangements available at competitive rates for qualifying buyers.

faqs.question: Puis-je obtenir un prêt hypothécaire en Espagne en tant qu'étranger ?
faqs.answer: Yes. Major Spanish and international banks provide mortgages to foreign buyers, typically financing 70-80% of property value. Requirements include valid income verification, passport, and residency documentation. English-speaking banking support is widely available through established property networks.

faqs.question: Quel est le coût de la vie sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Living costs are significantly lower than Northern Europe. Monthly expenses for a couple average €1,500-2,000 including rent, utilities, groceries, and discretionary spending. Healthcare, education, and dining remain particularly affordable compared to UK or Northern European standards. Property ownership eliminates housing costs for many residents.

faqs.question: La Costa Blanca est-elle adaptée aux retraités ?
faqs.answer: Excellent. Costa Blanca attracts retirees due to year-round Mediterranean climate, affordable living, excellent healthcare with English-speaking providers, established expatriate communities, and leisure activities. Many retirees generate supplementary income through property rentals or continued professional work.

faqs.question: Quel temps fait-il sur la Costa Blanca ?
faqs.answer: Finestrat enjoys Mediterranean climate with over 300 days annual sunshine, average winter temperatures 10-15°C, and summer temperatures 25-30°C. Sea breezes moderate heat during summer months. Rainfall concentrates in autumn and spring. Overall conditions provide year-round outdoor living comfort.
